intro: Gilibertia amamiensis, commonly known as the Amami gilibertia, is a flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically followed by small, spherical fruits. Gilibertia amamiensis is of interest to botanists due to its restricted distribution and unique morphological features.
